TYPE: Vehicle Collision or Pedestrian Struck (with Injury)

1.Theft from Vehicle (36.7%) is 2.5x higher than the next category (Mischief 14.2%)
→ Indicates extreme dominance of a single crime type — strong skew in distribution.

2.Break & Enter Residential (13.1%) is almost double Commercial (7.3%)
→ Residential areas face higher vulnerability than commercial spaces.

3.Mischief (14.2%) slightly exceeds Residential Break-ins (13.1%)
→ Property damage incidents are as significant as actual intrusion crimes.

4.Theft of Bicycle (5.3%) is lower than expected compared to Theft from Vehicle (36.7%)
→ Suggests vehicle-related theft is a much larger urban risk factor.

5.Vehicle Collision with Injury (4.4%) is lowest but high impact
→ Low frequency, but critical severity — forecasting should treat it separately from property crimes.
